      Parameters:

    • setDMSPrecision

      public static void setDMSPrecision(GeocoordMatch m)
      set precision on a DMS text coordinate -- simply if the Match latitude "has seconds" then its precision is seconds, otherwise if it has minutes, then it is precise to +/- 1 minute, etc. Default precision is half-degree ~ +/- 55KM. Prior implementation was based on digit counting, whereas with decimal degrees you must count digits to infer precision.
      Parameters:
      m - DMS match

    • setMGRSPrecision

      public static void setMGRSPrecision(GeocoordMatch m)
      Parameters:
      m - MGRS match

    • setUTMPrecision

      public static void setUTMPrecision(GeocoordMatch m)
      Parameters:
      m - UTM match

    • UTM_precision

      public static float UTM_precision(String utm)
      For now default UTM precision to +/- 100m
      Parameters:
      utm - UTM string
      Returns:
      precision

    • format

      public static String format(double f, int digits)
      This was deemed to be more Java like, however performs 10x slower than format2() -- which unfortunately rounds too early.
      Parameters:
      f - value
      digits - digits to include in format
      Returns:
      formatted value.
